title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Physical Science Stream
description: Strong results in the Physical Science stream are mandatory. A solid foundation in Combined Mathematics and Physics is essential for understanding the core principles of electronics and communication.

title: BSc Engineering Degree (Electronic & Telecom)
description: Complete a 4-year IESL-accredited BScEng (Hons) degree specializing in Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering. The curriculum covers analog/digital electronics, signal processing, and communication systems.

title: Graduate Engineer & IESL Associate Membership
description: Begin your career in the telecommunication industry, electronics design firms, or embedded systems companies. Register with IESL as an Associate Member to start your path to chartership.

title: Achieve Chartered Engineer Status
description: Gain at least four years of relevant post-graduate experience under a Chartered Engineer. Fulfill all training requirements and pass the IESL professional review to become a Chartered Engineer (CEng).
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and chartership

title: Senior Engineer / Technical Lead
description: Advance to a senior role, leading projects in areas like 5G network deployment, IoT product development, or semiconductor design. This requires deep specialization and the ability to manage complex technical projects.
institutes: All major telecom and electronics design companies
